messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/2/2000 11:20:07 PM Pacific Standard Time, heathfam@direct.ca writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/2/2000 11:20:07 PM Pacific Standard Time,
heathfam@... writes:

<< The only solution I have thought of so far is to re-educate myself and then
share what I am learning in the form of "stories"... and hopefully spawn an
interest so that later on they will continue to add pieces to the puzzle as
they present themselves in life. >>

Hi All, I would like to take a moment to introduce myself and then comment on
history. I am the unschooling mother of two in Portland Oregon. I love the
unschooling life and write about it extensively on my home page and in my new
job, the unschooling editor for Suite101. I am also a freelance writer and
own way to many pets:)

For us, history is one of the easiest things of all to learn, we use books,
Like the Witch of Black Bird Pond, to get a feel for the time period. We also
use movies and further investigate whatever piques our interest.

I look forward to getting to know you all and learning from this list:)
Teri
